raw_comment: According to the graph, students with parents who make a higher income have a greater chance of being admitted to an elite university than those with parents who make a lower income.  It is obvious to anyone that the rate of admissions goes up exponentially once the income rank reaches above the 80th rank.  This may be caused by two things, either the school admits more students in higher income families because they believe the parents might make sizable donations to the school, or it is because more higher income families can afford to send their children to elite colleges and poorer families can't and do not apply.
ace_sentences: The graph shows a relation between the income of parents and admission to an elite university.
Students who have parents with a higher income have a greater chance of admission to an elite university than students who have parents with a lower income.
The admission rate increases strongly when the income rank is above the 80th rank.
This increase may have two causes.
One possible cause is that the university admits more students from higher-income families.
The university may believe that parents from higher-income families will make sizable donations to the university.
Another possible cause is that more higher-income families can afford to send their children to elite universities.
Many lower-income families cannot afford to send their children to elite universities.
Many lower-income families do not apply to elite universities.
